1331221.content:
The following series of chapters are taken from a collab myself and godlyhorse did off site.


Toph was inside a shop in the Earth Kingdom Capital City of Ba Sing Se looking a bit unimpressed with the woman flapping her gums about some vial to her that when she takes it would give her the ‘Capacity to be the greatest Earthbender on this planet’. Frankly she was already great but who could pass up a chance to be even greater?

“So Toph, what will it be? Do you want the vial that will give you power beyond imagining?” She asked her in a suspenseful tone to her with a wry grin.

“Hmm, how much is it?” She asked her curiously, since every pawn shop has a price for something these days.

“10 Coins.” The shopkeeper replied blandly.

“I’ll take it!” She agreed to these terms, taking 10 gold coins out of her pocket and placed it on the table as she grinned at the possibilities she might do with these new powers.

“Thanks kid, here ya go.” She told her as she handed her the green vial.

Toph swiped it and uncorked it immediately, “Wait!” The woman halted her from bringing the liquid up to her mouth.

“Whaaat? You got your money!” Toph snapped before making a show of chugging the whole vial before belching at the shopkeeper. “You can keep this to tell people you helped the most powerful Earth-Bender!” Toph dropped the vial onto the counter and walked away laughing.

The shopkeeper was stunned and couldn’t help but feel as if she’d just unleashed something terrible upon the world.

Toph marched through the streets of Gaoling, head held high and ego being inflated as her mind was filled with thoughts of being ‘Queen of Earthbending’ and things of that nature.

She didn’t notice the heavy footprints she was beginning to leave on the ground as she inched up in height.

Now as one could tell, Toph was one that was a bit short for her age, as the people walking down the roads looked a bit curious at the fact that she was leaving foot shaped indents in the dirt with her feet, it seems like whatever was in that vial, she was not only growing in size but in strength as well.

However they wrote it off as just being the trick of the light or something considering that any inches she gained it wouldn’t be enough to be noticed as easy especially as she was moving down the road and as they say, out of sight, out of mind.

‘Heh, I wonder how much I can do with these enhanced powers, maybe I can test them out at that Earth Rumble underground tournament, heard it was 6 this time.’ She thought to herself, they seem to hold it every month so plenty of time to get in and have some fun with it.

Toph hitched a ride on a wagon, earning a few stares when the wagon groaned under her slightly increased weight, back to the Bei Fong estate.

Sneaking back in and donning her formal attire (couldn’t have her parents finding out about the whole ‘Blind Bandit’ thing after all), Toph wandered out into the garden, already knowing her mother was there.

Something strange happened then, it was almost as if Toph was suddenly able to make out more detail through her feet’s sensitivity on the ground.

Her mother: Poppy Bei Fong, patted the seat next to her to indicate Toph to sit beside her. However, Poppy’s eyes slightly widened, and Toph could somehow sense this. “Toph, have you gotten taller?”

“Um, yes mother, I must’ve been going through some puberty lately.” She told her politely, not wanting to give away that she went anywhere this entire day, that would be one heck of an explanation to give them, and the extra security.

“That’s wonderful Toph, you’ll soon grow up to be a beautiful woman, I should ask your teacher to be wary of any boys going near you.” She said in a light teasing tone to which Toph blushed at the suggestion, that would be embarrassing to go through.

“Please don’t do that mom I can take care of them.” She implored her to not do that, it’s a bit too much considering how she’s already being pigeon-holed already to basic Earthbending techniques when she knows a lot more than that.

“Oh, Toph. You shouldn’t trouble yourself with them, boys will be boys after all. Either way, I was merely joking.” Poppy chuckled. Toph breathed a quiet sigh of relief, dodged a bullet there.

“Earth Rumble Tournament is this weekend...I can’t have myself being doted on or followed, or the Blind Bandit’s career is over.” Toph thought to herself, whatever these new powers of hers were, this was sure to be fun testing them out on challengers at the tournament.

Today was Thursday, the Earth Rumble Underground Tournament was held Friday through Saturday.

One thing was for sure, by Friday night...The Blind Bandit was sure to make a ruckus.

The next afternoon, the Earth Rumble Tournament was sold out, snacks were being bought as people filtered into the arena.
1331221.title: She Grows

13312211.content:
Xin Fu was greedily counting his money, but upon looking over the competitors in the back room...he noticed one peculiarly missing champion.

“Where is the Blind Bandit?! The tournament is sold out!” Xin Fu was thrown into a panic...that is until the floor began to vibrate from a series of stomps coming up behind the promoter and host of Earth Rumble.

The ground shook with a rhythm similar to footsteps as he turned around to see and then had to look up to the sneering face of Toph whom had grew to about eight feet tall, far from the little girl she used to be.

“Calm down little man, wouldn’t want you to waste your money on all these people showing up for me now would you?” She rhetorically asked him, now Xin Fu was no average sized man but his head coming to level with her chest made him feel quite intimidated by her as she walked past him and to the area where they were holding the other contestants, leaving the stupefied man behind.

“W-well, looks like the new and improved Blind Bandit has made it to Earth Rumble Six! Let’s hear it for her!” He hollered out to the crowd as they cheered out her name making Toph grin in anticipation of the coming matches as she sensed her opponents’ heart rates going up at seeing her towering over most of the opposition.

And with the growth persisting in the background, it would make the competitors lives harder than the other unlucky sap pitted against her.

The first opponent Toph would face would be a burly man calling himself The Boulder. Toph gave a wicked smirk at the man who only came up below her chin. She could sense his fear..and it pumped her up even more to know that her mere presence was causing such anxiety in challengers.

“The B-Boulder doesn’t find it satisfying to be facing a mere child! No matter how humongous she may be!” The Boulder tried to sound intimidating.

Toph merely scoffed and sneered at The Boulder as if he were a mere insect in her way. “The Boulder? Y’sure about that? You look more like The Pebble from up here!” She burst into mocking laughter, along with some of the crowd.

The Boulder clenched his fists and teeth at the mocking laughter from the crowds and his opponent.

The gong was rung, and the match was set to begin. The Boulder gave a battle cry and summoned two walls of rock on either side of Toph.

“The Boulder will be fine with pummeling you!” The objects began to smash together on either side of a yawning Toph..who merely put her hands out to her sides and shattered the oncoming projectiles.

Smirking at the shocked Boulder’s face, Toph didn’t notice herself getting a bit bigger.

They both didn't notice it, but Toph’s feet slowly grew wider and covered more of the stone tiles on the arena floor as the cracks slowly edged out from there, it was a snail's pace practically but something that would be noticed more later on.

“What kind of Earthbending was that? My hands just shattered your rock wall Pebble.” She taunted at the man as she cracked her knuckles and with a shift of her right foot forward, the the 4 floor tiles in front of her rose up by a foot and sent straight towards The Boulder like a stone wave at rather fast speeds.

He tried to put up a barrier before they hit but only barely and the force of it sent him flying back from the impact. “What a wuss! I barely put any effort into that.” Toph mocked his attempt at defense while inside she was beaming with excitement, she really didn't put much into it and here he was sprawled out across the floor, she couldn't wait to see just what else she can do with her abilities.

Toph grinned as she began to stomp across the arena tiles toward the winded Boulder. As the rather pudgy man attempted to wobble to his feet, the quakes she was making caused him to flop onto his back once more. Toph pinned him to the floor with a wide and ever slowly expanding foot.

The Boulder wheezed as the mischievous girl ground her sole into his belly, the crowd was enthralled by this display of dominance and were chanting ‘Blind Bandit!’.

Placing his hand on the floor, Boulder sent a hurl of rocks toward Toph to get her off of him. Toph smirked and hopped backwards, lifting one foot and letting the rocks impact her wide sole.

When the dust cleared, Boulder had staggered to his feet and saw Toph holding her foot up, sole facing him and toes wiggling tauntingly...sprinkling toe grime and the rocks which had been reduced to rubble onto the floor.

“Looks like you’re outta luck Pebble.” She said mocking his efforts before she walked back over to the man on the floor as she lifted her foot over him and stepped on his face, just enough to cause him some pain but not to completely smash it open.

His screaming was muffled by the sole and the crowd’s cheering Toph on for her display of violence and humiliation, after this night was over, The Boulder would be pretty humbled after this.

He could smell nothing but the sweat and musky foot odor that was propagated by the rather intense lighting from above, he flailed around and struggled as much as he could before he exhausted himself and inhaled even more of her foot odor.

“You can always tap out you know, there’s no shame to being beaten by a blind girl’s foot alone.” Toph taunted him and lifted her foot off of him to see his sweat covered face wrapped in abject terror and disgust from the odor he had faced. It was time to cut losses and fold them.

He tapped the ground three times before the gong sound signalling that the match was over for him as Toph squatted next to him and said, “You know, doing what you did is pretty much the smartest thing a person can do, thanks for doing that Pebble.” She said before standing up and punted him over to the edge of the arena for the medics to take him to the infirmary.

The crowd roared in approval and chanted her stage-name, Toph held her hands up in victory and worked the crowd up more.
13312211.title: Continue [reserved]

133122111.content:
Xin Fu had watched the whole thing from afar, he was standing in the back area with the other, now absolutely terrified, competitors. He didn’t know what the brat had done to make herself get so big and strong, but what he DID know was that she was gonna make him a LOT of money.

The floor quaked as Blind Bandit marched proudly backstage, smirking as she passed the other competitors and made sure to put in a bit of extra ‘oomph’ into her footsteps.

“Is it just me...or is she looking even b-bigger?” She heard one of the quivering soon-to-be opponents whisper. She made sure she stomped REALLY hard when she passed him, he squealed like a baby.

“That was amazing, kid! I don’t know how you’re getting so big, but it’s gonna make you absolutely famous!” Xin Fu said, his eyes practically turning into dollar signs.

Toph felt her ego swell even more...she really would be the biggest and baddest Earth Bender in the world if this kept up!

Hell, she might not even NEED Xin Fu for that...but she’ll see.

“Heh, if you say so, just keep them matches coming and I might stay a bit longer.” She told him, wanting to make it clear that she can simply take her business and fans elsewhere if there’s no fun to be had in this place.

“Of course kid, whatever you want, just keep up the good work!” He said laughing a little as the others grew pale with fear, so they were reduced to being a punching bag for a girl that practically towers over them?

“That’s what I like to hear.” Toph said chuckling before turning to the other competitors, “Alright you little girls, I think if you’d like your time to be a pleasant one here, I’d expect you to do your best, no lackluster fighting or else, got it?” She told them with a stomp of her foot for emphasis, making the others jump slightly in place from the force of it.

They nodded frantically not wanting to get on her bad side, “Good.” She said grinning haughtily with her hands on her hips.

The next fight was coming up in a few moments, Toph sat sprawled out on a bench all to herself, ‘eyeing’ up her competition menacingly. She enjoyed the fear she could produce in them, in a cruel way.

Crossing one foot over her knee, sole facing the lineup of soon opponents on their chairs, Toph playfully wiggled her plump toes and scrunched her sole.

Now the group couldn’t swear to it...but did her feet look bigger? They didn’t focus on it too much, as the rank foot odor she was wafting at them was shaking them to their core.

Toph closed her eyes and sighed in relaxation, she was really enjoying putting the fear into these losers. And not to mention the fact that she could faintly feel herself growing more and more powerful if she focused really hard, it probably might be uncontrollable but she has no problems with it.

The other competitors were practically quaking in their boots from the power she had over them, they don't know why but they were filled with a sense of dread seeing her Amazon sized body despite having the same proportions as ever.

The bench creaked with every shifting movement she made as the smell wafted through the air, “You people quaking already from just my foot odor? Man you guys are some babies, that still won't save you from getting out of these matches since it looks like each of you gotta have some private time with them.” Toph taunted them with a mocking laugh, wiggling her toes at them, as her heels stuck out slightly over the edge of her bench even while laying down…

A few minutes passed before Xin Fu returned, by that time Toph had grown a bit more and her feet were hanging off the end of the bench and in front of the closest competitors face. Toph of course was aware of this and took pleasure in wafting her toes at him, causing him to turn a bit green.

Due to her body ever slowly increasing in size, her sweat output had been ramped up, seemingly a side effect….but quite the amusing one in Toph’s opinion. Xin Fu pointed to the cringing young man, “Rockslide! You’re up against Blind Bandit!”

Toph could hear the so called Rockslide whimpering a bit as he stood up to walk out onto the arena, Toph leaped from the bench and caused a mini-earthquake which staggered her next opponent.

She stood there smirking down at him with her hands on her hips and patted him on the head, “Don’t worry...I won’t hurt ya TOO bad.” She stomped out onto the arena, laughing uproariously as the sounds of the crowd cheering met their ears.

The next three matches went by one after another and all ending in the same relative fashion. Toph mocked her opponent and depending upon the person they were either already terrified of her or were stubbornly brave. The latter ones she took extra care to break down until they were a defeated, cowering mess at her less than clean feet.

There was no question in Xin Fu or any of the remaining competitors minds: Toph WAS indeed growing bigger.

Given the fact that this was a tournament, there was an hour intervention before the latter half of the tournament.

Toph by this time had grown to 12 ft. in height and was loving every second of it. Her soles had left wet imprints all over the arena tiles.

Currently the Blind Bandit was seated in the room which she currently took up a lot of space in, eating from a bag of chips and drinking a soda. She was using a couple of former competitors who had forfeited as footstools, a fitting punishment for their cowardice.

They groaned in exertion from trying to hold up her large feet on their backs, hands and knees buckling slightly from trying to keep up the appendages that was as big as a torso.

“Hahaha, did you guys see that last match where I spent minutes just destroying all of his rocks and walls by walking through it?” She asked them with a smirk as she ate her chips, she knows they probably was watching that last one but she wanted to rub it in the guy that was holding up her left foot.

The other losers were busy fanning her and catering to snack resupply when she finishes inhaling the bag of chips practically, the next bunch of competitors felt sorry for the losers and for themselves since they too will inevitably fall to this mountain of a girl.

Later on after the break the footstools were practically pressed against the ground as her incrementally increasing weight was making it harder and harder to hold up as she sneered and got up. “What wimps.” She commented on how they were breathing for air as she told the others, “See you guys in the ring.” She taunted them and went away, the ground shaking slightly with her footsteps.
133122111.title: Continue [Reserved]

1331221111.content:
-Hours into the night later-

“Amazing work! You're the biggest star the Earth Rumble has ever seen!! Um...no pun intended.” Xin Fu nervously added on to his praises.

Toph now loomed over the man at a whopping 17 ft. She had fought and grown long into the night. It was now far past any reasonable kid's bedtime, but Toph was full of energy and adrenaline.

Plus, she wasn't exactly an ordinary child.

In reply to his praise, Toph grinned smugly, this guy was completely under her thumb. She'd get anything she wanted from him provided she keeps cash coming in.

A desire to have everyone at her whims had begun to sprout within her.

“How would you like to be the face of Earth Rumble? We could triple your pay and perks! You'd be a star, a BIG star!!” Xin Fu made the offer.

“Thanks, I’ll be sure to get in some major cash for ya.” Toph said looking down at the man at her feet, from what she can sense she was nearly the size of an average house, as tall as one anyways.

“Alright, I’ll see what we can work out tomorrow, see you here.” He told her as he walked home with his new earnings, this kid could be a real cash cow for him in the long run.

Toph nodded as she walked off into the night, with everyone sleeping around these times not many were up tonight to see her walking about, though some were wondering why the ground was shaking slightly.

Considering the dilemma of her being sighted by her parents as a 17ft tall Earthbender and counting, they’d just try and keep her all locked up like some monster. “Bah they don't know what is best for me, I’m tough, I can do this all by myself.” She muttered to herself as she walked about the place leaving trails of footprints in the process.

Even at this ridiculous hour of the night, Toph could tell there had been an improvement in her senses. She couldn’t see through her eyes, but her sense of chi had seemingly been pumped up to where she could sense details and features of people via their chi pathways.

The soles of her feet were now able to tell her more about her surroundings than ever before, making being huge even more enjoyable than it might otherwise have been.

She stood next to a building with her hands on her hips, grinning at the place which she was able to peer into the windows of with no trouble at all. It was certainly fun being big!

Her enormous ears picked up a sound coming from a nearby alleyway, someone was being mugged!

Toph grinned smugly, time to have some MORE fun! She stomped around the side of the building and ‘saw’ the scene. A thug had cornered a kid and was holding a knife, threatening the sniffling little boy.

Toph could ‘see’ that this boy had obviously been in the audience at the tournament, and could make out details of a shirt he was wearing that said: ‘Blind Bandit’ on it and held an action figure of her!

“Xin Fu must’ve really went all in on the merch…” Toph thought before cracking her knuckles and gaining the thug and his victim’s attention.

The young boy’s bright eyes went wide and he gasped, “It’s really you! The Blind Bandit! You’re in for it now ya big bully!” He stuck his tongue out at the mugger.

“The heck are you talking about?” He demanded incredulously before he heard Toph clear her throat and turned around before whatever threat he had in store died in his mouth as he saw the 17 ft tall and counting girl standing behind him.

“What the hell are you!?” He questioned as he dropped the knife unconsciously, not that it would do him any good against skin that tough.

“The person that’s gonna beat the crap out of you in ten seconds unless you get outta here and away from the kid.” She warned him tapping her foot and making the ground shake slightly from it.

Without any further prompting, the would be robber ran for his life running between her legs and having to briefly deal with the ridiculous musk emitting from her sweaty feet and coughing in the process, until he made his way down the street screaming in fear all the while.

“Heh, serves him right.” Toph said with hands on her hips, smirking, before her lips drew to a straight line as she looked down at the kid and kneeled down, “You alright kid?” She asked him in concern, hoping the idiot didn't rough him up too badly.

“I’m fine, thanks to you Blind Bandit! You’re so awesome! Thanks for saving me!” The innocent boy said, clearly star-struck.

Toph grinned widely, “Yeah, no biggie. I gotta look out for the fans, ya know?” She answered.

The boy scurried away, waving goodbye as he parted ways with his hero. “I can’t wait to see when you fight next! I hope you get even BIGGER!” The boy said over his shoulder, causing Toph to smirk and answer: “Don’t worry, kid! I will!”

Truthfully, Toph could already feel herself growing a bit more as power coursed through her body. “Yeah...that’s not gonna be a problem. Not like finding a place to stay…” Toph mumbled thoughtfully to herself.
1331221111.title: Continue 1

13312211111.content:
Then it dawned on her, a certain someone who employed her and who she had completely at her mercy financially...a wicked smirk formed on her face.

She’d have him at her beck and call in his own home!

Xin Fu had just sat down to count his money, when a thumping sound that rattled the windows themselves erupted from his front door.

Xin Fu approached the door...just as a booming voice thundered from the other side. “Yo! Lemme in or I’ll bust the door down! It wouldn’t be a problem for your BIGGEST money maker!”

Xin Fu opened the door and found himself staring at Toph’s legs and her colossal feet.

The girl had grown AGAIN.

“What the heck? Blind Bandit how did you know where I lived?” He asked incredulously, he knows that she can sense things through the earth but to be able to track him from this distance, that was a bit scary.

“My earth sensing abilities have been getting better and better, now I can practically track down specific heartbeats, cool right?” She asked him rhetorically as she got on her hands and knees so he can get a look at her face, suffice to say, Toph was about 20ft tall by the time she got to his house.

“But that doesn't answer the question of why you are here to begin with.” Xin Fu questioned Toph, who smiled a bit at his question, “Well if I’m being honest, the place where I was at is getting too small for me, so I’m crashing in with you.” She told him with no room for argument.

“Wait what? You’re not living here period, go find your own house to crash in.” He rebuked her statement and stupidly decided to close the door to her face, which was in a sense a bad move to make considering she likes having a little challenge every now and again.

Toph chuckled deeply, so that was how he wanted to play was it? A sudden quake rocked the entire house and sent Xin Fu sprawling onto his back in front of the slammed door. Toph had merely just flopped onto her rump, imagine what damage she could do if she was actually doing something...well violent?

Xin Fu didn’t know what had just happened, but he could imagine that Toph wasn’t exactly pleased with how he’d rudely rejected her.

Just as he’d started to think he’d been too harsh and most likely hurt her feelings...Toph reared back her stinky and increasingly sweaty barefoot and slammed it through the door.

The plump young foot reduced the door to splinters and Xin Fu was promptly given a face full of soft, squishy yet firm sole that stunk to high heaven.

He was thrown back from the force of it as he was unfortunate to take a whole lungful of the foot odor and perspiration of sweat that was on the sole, before he tumbled back and hit the base of the beginning of the staircase, it was the small mercies that he had a large central living room.

“So I bet that knock got through to you huh? So what were you saying now?” She asked in a taunting tone as she wiggled her toes at him as if to dare him to say otherwise.

“Okay you can stay where ever you want just please don't trash anymore of my house!” He pleaded with her. It was a few seconds before the foot soon receded through the entrance it had made.

“Glad we can work something out, now it might be a tight squeeze for me.” Toph said before she got onto her hands and knees and started to crawl in through the hole she made, tearing up and gouging a bigger hole in the wall in the process.

Xin Fu clenched his hands on the sides of his scalp in horror as he watched her grunt and squeeze her rump through the hole.

“B-be careful-!” Xin Fu started to exclaim, only for the hole to be made even wider as she jerked her lower half through and into his living room.

“Phew, that’s better!” She flopped on her backside and looked around, surprised she had a lot more space than expected.

“So uh...how are you going to get OUT?” Xin Fu inquired.
“Relax, little fella! You’ll get compensated for all of this damage….and the rest of it when I get bigger.” Toph grinned slyly.

“B-bigger?! No no no no! You’re going to outgrow the house or something! Make it stop!” Xin Fu demanded.

Toph merely scoffed and flexed her plump toes at him, sending him into a hacking fit. “I don’t think I asked YOUR opinion...and besides, I’m your BIG star remember? If you want..I can just take my talents elsewhere.” She turned up her nose at him haughtily.

“W-wait, hold on! I just uh...don’t want you destroying my house is all. Please don’t leave…” Xin Fu begged.

Toph grinned smugly, “Then I suggest you put all that cash I got you to good use and build ME a nice palace or mansion or something. After all, I’m gonna be the Earthbending Queen. I appreciate you letting me stay here and all but….it’s a little cramped.” Toph joked.

“Earthbending Queen?” Xin Fu raised an eyebrow.

“Yup!” Toph relaxed back with her hands behind her head, her upper half reaching into the dining room.

“It’s kinda chilly with that draft coming in, go get me some blankets and pillows! And make me some food...I’m starving after my tournament victory!” Toph demanded, he heard her stomach growling.

Xin Fu growled slightly but stifled any scathing response to her ordering him around like some maid, he went to the kitchen to go grab some food from the fridge that apparently he now has to go and overstock to give Toph a new supply of food.

But at the very least the comfort that it's only until he finds a construction crew that can build a big enough palace to hold her in was a small one, but it was something that can make him put up with her.

Toph chuckled as she ‘saw’ him walk to the kitchen, it was awesome using her size to just boss him around like some sort of queen, though at the rate she was getting more power and size queen might soon not be enough!

‘Heh, this is so cool, and to think its STILL not done growing, maybe I’ll just be growing forever.’ She thought to herself arrogantly, imagining armies of Firebenders or whatever just throwing themselves in droves as her massive feet just stomp them into the dirt.

It was soon that he brought back a bag full of food for her to eat as he placed it beside her. “Thank you, now go get my blankets and pillows!” She ordered him to do so as he then ran up the stairs to go get what she demanded, she then chuckled and placed her hands behind her head and relaxed.
13312211111.title: Continue 1

133122111111.content:
-About Two Weeks later…-

Xin Fu was run ragged by Toph in the following weeks. Her demands and attitude had gotten totally out of hand, getting worse with each growth spurt as her ego swelled.

It didn’t help that his house had to undergo extensive (and expensive) repairs thanks to Toph literally outgrowing it. Not that the self-proclaimed Earthbending Queen cared, she was too full of herself and her new power to bother with petty things like that!

Speaking of the Blind Bandit, her increasing size gave her quite the following, even more fans than before! Her exploits had reached all throughout the Earth Kingdom, and the Earth Rumble had been moved to a bigger arena both for seating purposes and the fact that Toph was having trouble fitting on the arena floor.

Toph was riding high on a wave of cash flow and the sheer power afforded her thanks to her increasing size.

She had now reached 35ft in height and it seemed nothing could stop her now!

Today was the day that Toph was coming to inspect her palace’s finished work. Xin Fu hoped it was to her liking and she’d finally have a place to stay that WASN’T his devastated house.

The ground shook, signalling the titan of a girl’s approach. People in the streets moved out of her way, both not to be crushed and to flee from the terrible foot odor and sweat.

The ground shaked as Toph came into view of the palace, she gotten even stronger with her sensory abilities and able to pick out the finer details in the area as she stepped towards the area and whistled in astonishment.

“Wow guys, didn’t think you’d be able to get it done so soon.” She praised them though she suppose that Xin Fu wanted her to get out of the house as soon as possible, which meant from the massive earnings to speed up the process.

The construction lead worker came up to her as she then told Toph, “Yeah, didn’t think so too, but I bet your client didn’t want to handle you for much longer.” She said chuckling a bit as well as Toph, “Hmm, so how is it inside?” She wondered looking over the place, it felt big enough from the outside.

“Well it should be good enough to last you for awhile, I could give you a tour to show you.” She offered to Toph looking over the construction paper and the deed to the palace that she should probably find someone to sign in her name.

“Sure, I can’t wait to see my Earth Queen throne!” Toph declared excitedly. The construction head paled then as she questioned: “T-throne, ma’am?”

Toph could sense the woman’s anxiety and narrowed her eyes menacingly at her. “Uh, yeah. I’m the Earthbending Queen after all!”

“Y-yes, of course! Xin Fu must’ve neglected to mention that! But we DID include one, an extravagant and comfortable one! Complete with footstool!” The woman fearfully said upon looking at the plans.

“Good call and just a heads up? I’m growing again.” Toph grinned smugly as she felt the oncoming growth spurt...as well as her sweat glands getting fired up.

The Blind Bandit wiped sweat from her brow as she shot up to 40 ft and stood with her hands on her hips. “I’d better still have LOTS of room in there!” Toph boomed.

“Y-yes of course, my Queen!” The woman at Toph’s gargantuan toes exclaimed. “I think I’ll just take a look around for myself, you’re a bit too tiny to keep up with me!” Toph roared with taunting laughter as she stepped directly over the woman and the workers, holding her sole over their heads for a moment before approaching the entrance to her palace.

The construction lead designer watched as the girl walked into her new home as she sighed tired and muttered to herself, “Kids these days…” She said dropping her shoulders and walking away to a cabin.

Toph walked through the living area of her palace, since she isn't that gaudy for attempts of narcissistic viewing of statues, she thinks having 2 statues of her awesome self in the Living Room and Bed room should do. Her footsteps made light thumps in the ground but fortunately the floor work was sturdy enough to not leave behind footprints all over the place, unless she felt like it anyways.

“Hopefully my powers get good enough for me to see color, I hope they didn't go overboard with gold and white or whatever.” She wondered at the idea, in actuality it was actually a more greenish silver that was used for painting the place.

But credits where credit worth due the place felt like she was normal sized maybe even a bit less, the wonders of what lighting a fire under Xin Fu’s butt could do for her. “And to think I’ll just get more powerful down the line, maybe I can get rid of those stupid Fire Nation people.” She mused.
Toph flopped into her enormous throne with a sigh, propping her plump and incredibly sweaty and reeking feet onto the green cushioned footstool before her. “This is the life…” She groaned and relaxed back.
133122111111.title: Continue 1

1331221111111.content:
-Three Weeks Later…-

The streets of Gaoling shook and more cracks appeared within the walls of the buildings that had just been rebuilt.

Toph had been getting bigger and bigger, she now was at a massive fifty ft. in height, a classic giantess size. She had gotten so powerful that when she decided to have her way with Gaoling one bored afternoon, the people could do nothing but attempt to play along with her in what she called ‘Tophzilla’.

The Blind Bandit had kept her career going, she was famous throughout the entire Earth Kingdom as being an undefeated champion who took pleasure in tormenting and humiliating her opponents...and anyone else really.

Her expansive shadow befell a row of buildings as the townspeople screamed and ran around in a panic. They heard her rumbling voice mock them: “Well well, what have we here? A bunch of puny bugs!” Her voice rattled the windows of nearby buildings.

Those closest to her feet were now doubled over with their hands clutched over their mouth and noses.

Queen Toph wasn’t a fan of baths, as everyone knew.

Toph could hear their gagging and it made her laugh to know her mere foot odor had such power!

They fled as fast as they could away from Toph to safety, the people was wondering when she would eventually get around to flexing her power over everyone in this town, at first it was rather minor bullying in the form of disrupting traffic and what not, but eventually it went to a downward spiral from there.

Toph chuckled at them running away from her as she called out to them, “Hey where you guys think you’re going?” She then started to leisurely chase after them as she kicked over an abandoned cart absentmindedly.

She raised a foot over a house and grinned in anticipation, she was waiting for quite a bit to try this out. Toph then stomped down on the structure as it seem to explode in a cloud of wood and concrete, “Man this is some awesome stuff.” She said grinning with a slight blush on her face from the rush of trivially destroying property, she flexed her toes in the middle of the debris and lifted up her foot from it and continued on her fun.

A couple of people were hiding in a building that only came up to Toph’s shins, it wasn’t exactly a large structure. Toph smirked as she could sense the trembling group who thought they could hide from her. Toph crossed her arms and pretended like she couldn’t find them, “Oh no! I can’t find them! Where could they have gone?” She proceeded to flop her butt down on a building across the street.

She casually looked up at the sky and pressed her plump dirtied toes against the windows, causing them to fog up and crack a little. “Sigh….I guess I’ll just have to give up!”

Toph’s toes were causing spiderwebs of cracks to appear in the windows, she pretended to just notice them screaming. “Did I hear something..?” She asked no one in particular..just as her toes increased the pressure she was putting on the building and smashed through the front wall.

“Okay, okay! We’ll come out!” The man yelled up at the gargantuan bully. Toph grinned slyly and stood up, “Huh? Did someone say something?” She casually raised her foot, and of course pretended not to notice the man...as she promptly stepped on him and pinned him beneath her wide sole.

The other people inside the damaged building screamed in horror, thinking she’d just killed the poor man.

When she lifted up her foot from the man it was revealed that she simply forced him into the ground, like literally into the ground in an outline of him, Toph is many things, and a Troll is one of them.

“Hehe, you should’ve seen the looks on your faces when you thought I stepped on him.” She said laughing from her own prank, she was able to make rather quick displays of Earthbending at this size that it was barely perceivable to others.

“That being said, don't think that you’re not in danger.” She reminded them as she flexed her toes for emphasis, spreading her pungent odor at the crowd that was in front of a building in the square to which they coughed and choked in response.

The realization that they are still in danger of having their noses rotted to nothing from her feet made sure to kick the crowd back into high gear in fleeing from her as she sneered at them and moved on after them.

Toph made sure to really put the extra force into her stomps, rattling buildings and in some cases causing plaster to fall from ceilings.

Toph roared with mocking laughter as she sent the townsfolk into a panic. This was great! She could do whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted to WHOEVER she wanted! She was unstoppable!

“Muahahahaha! Look out puny mortals! The Earthbending Queen has ARRIVED!” Toph bellowed as she lifted her foul smelling foot and smashed it down onto a local shop.

The poor shopkeeper had never seen anything like it, a gigantic foot crashing through his ceiling that obliterated his entire livelihood like it was made out of paper!

Toph peeked inside and stuck her tongue out, “Sucks for you!” she snarked before continuing on her reign of terror.

That was when the local law enforcement decided to step in..as foolish as that was to do.

“Stop your attack, giant girl! We are to escort you back to your parent’s estate!”

Toph’s eyes narrowed slightly at the threat they made to try and take her back to her Parents, ever since she had to kinda break the news to her parents, they were at first tried to used their authority over her only to be rebuked by the garden getting a bit of a redecorating.

“Yeah that's not gonna happen pal, run along or else.” She threatened them in return as she stomped closer to them towering over the Earth Kingdom police with her slowly increasing body and glared at them.

“If you won't come willingly then we have to take you by force.” The leader of the squad of Earthbenders declared though he was a bit hesitant to try to take on this giant girl, he was bound by duty to do so.

“Hey man by all means go ahead and try.” Toph invited him to do so with a challenging smile on her face knowing that it would only end with them beaten to a pulp.

“Very well! Restrain her!” The other two Earthbenders formed large chains made of rock from the ground which wrapped around Toph. Toph burst into laughter as she merely broke free like they were made of paper.

“What was that supposed to be?!” Toph mocked as she lifted her foot and flexed her toes, wafting rotten foot odor down upon the now gagging Earthbenders.

“What’s wrong? Don’t have anything to say?” Toph sneered and stomped her foot down, thankfully the Earthbenders jumped out of the way in time.

The Earthbenders had hopped onto rooftops which barely came up to Toph’s torso.
She scowled as a prison made of Earth formed around her like a cage. The Earthbenders added layer after layer of thick rock bars to it in an attempt to prevent her from escaping so easily.

Toph scoffed and reared her fist back, smashing through the side of the cage and grabbing a screaming Earthbender in her fist.
1331221111111.title: Continue 1

13312211111111.content:
She brought him to her face as she glared faintly at his direction, “What was that supposed to be? A grand attempt at holding me, nothing can stop me don't you get it?” She boasted arrogantly and threw him at a building making him skid off the rooftops in pain from the blow.

Toph then raised her foot and stomped down hard on the ground, causing a large crack to travel up from where she impacted and to the cage where it seem to explode outwards.

“See how pointless it is, just go home and let a girl have her fun.” She told them to which they answered back with a large blunt Rock spike to jut out of the ground and strike her in the stomach rather hard, making her stagger a bit and tripped on a house behind her, as she fell back and smashed it underneath her body, sending up a lot of smoke.

The remaining Earthbenders walked to the site while one of them asked out loud, “Did we get her?”

Their answer was a low growl which turned into a roar of anger. “RrrrrAAGH! You’re really ticking me off!” As the smoke cleared, the Earthbenders would see the tomboyish Blind Bandit had increased in height and was STILL growing thanks to her rage. She stood there, at close to 55ft in height, glowering down at her prey.

“You just lost your chance to get outta this.” She said dangerously as she utilized her enhanced Earthbending skills to send pillars smashing into their backs, most likely causing more damage than intended to their bones.

Lifting her foot up, she let them impact her sole and in an instant smashed this foot down, pinning them beneath mountains of stinky foot flesh as she ground them into the dirt. “You’d better start kissing up if ya wanna survive!” Toph roared with a sinister grin.

They groaned in pain as Toph grinded her foot onto their bodies, causing them copious amounts of pain. But still they resisted her attempts at dominance by not giving in to her demands, at least for a little while longer while their bones were feeling the pressure.

Meanwhile at the entrance of Gaoling, a familiar trio was standing there looking for the girl that was in Aang’s vision of whom would teach him about Earthbending, though in another timeline it would had been easy though with its own set of issues, this one might be a bit harder to do.

Katara looked concerned by the smoke billowing from multiple building in the distance as she wondered, “I hope this is the right place, had the Fire Nation attacked this town?”

“I don't know about you but I think this place kinda smells a bit don't you think?” Sokka commented, fanning his nose from faint disgust, “Come on guys, the least we can do is just search.” Aang told them helpfully.

Without any other reason to argue with that logic, they started to make their way into the town and where they saw civilians hiding and fleeing for their lives.

“Uhh...guys? Who is that?” Sokka fearfully pointed upward to a green clad giant figure with black hair who seemed to be the cause of the chaos and destruction.

“No way...that’s the girl I saw in my vision!” Aang declared as he rushed off towards the giantess.

“Aang! Wait!” Katara yelled after the free-spirited Avatar. Aang pinched his nose as he approached Toph’s meaty heel.

“So THAT’S where that stink is coming from!” Aang commented, unfortunately gaining Toph’s attention.

“Huh? What do you want? Can’t ya see I’m busy, kid?” Toph snapped and stomped her foot which didn’t have the two Earthbenders beneath it.

Aang seemed undaunted, “Heey! I’m the Avatar, can you teach me Earthbending?”

Toph’s eyebrow twitched, whoever this kid was...he couldn’t take a hint. And what was this about being the Avatar?

“Beat it, shrimp!” Toph roared before going back to tormenting the two Earthbenders beneath her.

One of the nearby civilians managed to hear his designation as he called out to him, “Hey Avatar, do you mind helping us take care of this giant girl? She’s trashing the town!”

Aang raised an eyebrow, that doesn't quite sound like a proper teacher at all, but nonetheless, it's his duty to help those in need.

“Alright I’m on it.” He said as he took out his air glider and flew on it upwards to her shoulder to get her attention, “Um, excuse me, do you mind leaving those people alone?” He asked her hoping to defuse the situation.

“Huh? How’d you get up here? Ugh, like a fly.” Toph complained as she raised a hand to swat him like a fly to which he quickly jumped off of to avoid getting hit.

“C’mon! This isn’t nice!” Aang scolded as he flipped upward and landed on her head.

Toph grit her teeth at this annoyance, “Grrrgh! Go away!” Toph reached up and ended up bonking herself on the head due to Aang moving out of the way.

“Sheesh...he’s fast…” Toph admitted in her thoughts, she sensed him on the ground with a clothespin on his nose and her eye twitched in annoyance as she lifted her foot which didn’t have the Earth Benders beneath it. “I’ll stomp you! Avatar or not!” She slammed her foot down on top of….Sokka!

“Noooooo!” Aang and Katara yelled, however Sokka’s extremely green tinted face was poking out from the giantess’ toes and he choked out: “D-don’t worry...I’m not dead...though I wish I was.”

Toph blushed, this guy she’d accidentally stomped in place of that annoying Avatar wannabe...was kinda cute.

“Well hello there, you look pretty nice little guy, why don't you ditch those annoying pests and come hang out with me?” She asked him with a grin on her face, getting a good read on his body really told a lot of what she had under her foot, maybe he’d make a good foot servant/boyfriend.

“Um, that’s not gonna happen.” Katara sternly reprimanded her as she waterbent water from a nearby pond and threw it at her and on impact it froze on her arm as she hissed in slight pain from the harsh cold on it and stepped off of the pinned Sokka and the Earthbenders as Toph broke off the ice of it with an annoyed growl.

“Please we just want to talk to you!” Aang spoke up as his plea was rebuked by the giant Toph as she lifted her foot over the two Benders as the boy went and threw Katara out of the way and evaded the stomp as it kicked up some dust in the process.
13312211111111.title: Continue 1

133122111111111.content:
Sokka groaned in discomfort from the foul odor that was in his nose and covered it, before he turned to his friends, “We need to stop this girl before she levels the town, not like she’s in the mood to talk right now!” He told them in apprehension.

“No, I’ve GOT to get her to teach me Earthbending.” Aang said in a determined tone as he hopped up onto a rooftop. “Heeeey! Waaait! Let’s talk about this!” Aang cupped his hands over his mouth and yelled at the titan of a girl..who if he didn’t know any better...was growing?!

“Nothing to talk about!” Toph snapped and reared her foot back a little bit, preparing to plow it through the building Aang was standing on.

Suddenly, Aang got an idea...but he didn’t think Sokka would like it very much. “What about a trade? You be my Earthbending teacher and come with us and stop destroying this place...and um….you’ll get all the access to Sokka you want!”

Toph’s foot stopped inches away from the building, Aang fanned the air slightly..but was glad to see what he’d said was obviously being considered.

“You travel with us, you can play with Sokka whenever and however long you like!” Katara jumped in, much to Sokka’s dismay.

“WHAT?! N-No way! How can you guys-!?” Sokka started to protest...before Toph replied with a grin: “Deal.” and turned around to walk in the direction of her palace.

“You wanna talk so bad...fine...you’ve earned yourself an audience with the Earthbending Queen.” Toph declared smugly.

“Wow! You’re a queen of Earthbending?!” Aang asked in childlike amazement as they started to follow behind her at street level.

“Well it's more of a self proclaimed title but as you can see, I am getting to really mean that title, I’m the strongest person you’d ever meet.” She bragged about her power and size as the civilians cowered in her presence but was confused by the Avatar being there.

As they make their way to the palace which like Toph herself, towered over everything in range as they gaped in awe of the structure, they wondered how long it took to make that sort of thing, it was like a place fit for the Earth King or something.

Katara though was curious about something else though, “You said you’re getting to claim that title for real, what do you mean by that?” She inquired as Toph smirked as she liked talking about her awesome powers.

“Well I’m glad you asked, ya see, I was a shrimp like you guys, and even worse vision skills, but after buying that vial from that lady in a store, it's been great, slowly getting bigger and stronger is the best thing ever.” She said to her with a light chuckle.

The four of them went up to the massive front double-doors which were green and gold befitting Toph’s stylistic choices. Toph pushed them open with both hands effortlessly, grinning smugly at this display of strength she just showed for her ‘guests’.

Sokka, Katara and Aang’s mouths dropped, and then dropped even furthur upon seeing the enormous throne room of the self titled Earthbending Queen.

It was luxuriously decorated with green and gold, the throne with the green carpet leading to it from the doorway was clearly dirtied with sweaty footprints.

“You must use this place a lot…” Katara commented with a slight fanning of air.

Toph smirked as she sensed that the girl smelt her ‘mark of territory’ all over the place. “Yup, so..you punies wanted an audience with the great and powerful Toph...ya gotta come up to the base of the throne and show your respect first. Kneel and thank me and all that.” She snickered and flopped herself casually onto the cushioned throne.

She snapped her fingers and draped herself across the armrests so that her feet were hanging from the side of the throne. With a mere finger snap, tiny normal sized servants came scuttling out of nowhere and propped a pillow behind her head as she rested her cheek against her fist.

Another set of servants scurried out and climbed up on a table next to her head, they were carrying a tray of grapes and Toph opened her mouth to be fed.

Knowing it’d be a great time as any to talk to the giant Earthbender, Aang then spoke to her, “So I was wondering, do you mind coming with us to help me learn to Earthbend since I’m the Avatar and all.” He informed her politely as the others kneeled before her to try and stay on her good side.

“And abandon my pretty sweet Palace in the process?” She questioned them with a raised eyebrow as she ate several bunches of grapes since she’s big enough to swallow each individual one whole.

“Think of it this way Toph, if you travel with us, you could spread your greatness to the world instead of in time as you grow.” Katara proposed to her to which she was intrigued by the notion of getting out of town, besides, beating up the same dudes that was at every Earth Rumble was getting boring.

“Do I still get your brother?” She asked her pointedly as Sokka widen his eyes in fear as he comically shook his head ‘no' to Katara but they were pressed for time.

“Yes.” She said to which he pathetically moaned in defeat at being Toph’s boytoy practically.

“Then we got ourselves a deal.” She said with a grin on her face at the idea of travelling all over the place, leaving her mark wherever she goes.
133122111111111.title: Continue

1331221111111111.content:
It had been a couple days since they had started their journey together. Toph had increased in height with time, she now stood at a whopping 65ft. It was afternoon time now, and the group was making camp in a forest on their way to the Earth kingdom capital of Ba Sing Se.

“Sooo..when do we start my training?” Aang inquired of Toph, who was seated and relaxing against a large rock wall she’d created. “Whenever I feel like it…” Toph answered back casually.

Aang pouted but left her be, not wanting to incur the wrath of the giantess which they clearly needed.

Toph opened one eye and glanced down beside her, she saw Sokka sitting there next to her titanic form as he was peeling potatoes for tonight’s stew.

“So uh...what’s it like?” Sokka asked her. “What’s what like?” Toph raised an eyebrow. “You know...being all big and unstoppable.” Sokka said as he turned toward her.

“Well you know, I can do whatever I want and answer to nobody, plus the fact that I keep getting bigger and stronger is the icing on the cake.” She told him with a grin on her face

“Sounds awesome but...what if you get TOO big?” Sokka said with a thoughtful expression. “Like...you might outgrow the entire country...or the planet.” Sokka snorted suddenly with slight laughter, “I just had an image in my head of you crushing the world between your toes.”

Toph laughed as well, her laughter nearly damaging his eardrums from how loud it was as she then said, “Yeah, I might actually enjoy that, who knows, I might be able to breathe in space or whatever with this stuff I drank.” She snickered in amusement.

“I could imagine like the whole world like my personal playground where I can stomp wherever and do whatever I want with nobody to stop me not even little Twinkle Toes over there.” She reasoned as at the rate she was gaining strength and size, it was a matter of time before she outstripped him in strength.

Sokka nodded in understanding as he sweated slightly nervous about that likely scenario, hopefully it might not come to pass, unless she’s like, unaging or something.

“So...I’m kinda afraid to ask but what are you gonna do once we get to Ba Sing Se? With the uh...Earth King and all that being there.” Sokka asked with a nervous chuckle.

Toph grinned deviously, “I’m gonna overthrow him, duh.”

A loud spit take was heard behind the wall, and Katara came charging in. “What!? You can’t do that!!” Katara shouted at Toph.

Toph merely rolled her eyes “And who’s gonna stop me? I’m too big and strong for anyone to tell ME what to do.” Toph declared.

“We’ve got a job to do! We can’t have you staging a coup against the Earth Kingdom on a whim!” Katara yelled.

“Katara, calm down. It might not be so bad...if she has control over the Earth Kingdom and it’s resources...we’d have a whole kingdom to back us up against the Fire Nation.” Sokka tried to reason with his sister.

“Aww, how cute! Looks like Sokka agrees with me!” Toph stuck her tongue out at Katara. “Get lost, Sugar Queen! If you want me to train Twinkle Toes then you’re gonna have to accept that I’m the boss.” Toph wafted her toes tauntingly at Katara.

Katara was about to retort back before Aang placed a reassuring hand on her shoulder, “It's alright Katara, besides she’s just here to come with us and do her own thing in return for teaching me Earthbending.” He told her trying to calm her fears.

“Well, alright then, I’ll trust in your judgement Aang.” She said to him with slightly unsure eyes and a wary smile but she could trust in his words and allow Toph her way.

“See now was that so hard? Just think of it like a small management change, the original goal hasn't changed but I’m just calling the shots now.” Toph said adding her two cents to the discussion as she folded her arms and looked at Aang with a challenging smile.

“Which reminds me, you ready to learn some real Earthbending skills?” She asked him as he grinned and nodded eagerly in preparation to learn as much as he can to earthbend.

“Great!”

With that, Toph merely wiggled her big toe and a rock pillar knocked Aang into the sky from below. “Waaaaaah!” Aang yelled as she wiggled her pinky toe and another pillar sprung up where he landed and knocked him back up again.

Sokka was falling over onto the ground laughing, causing Toph to laugh along with him and somewhat hurt his eardrums with her booming voice.

“Keep dodging, Twinkle-Toes!” Toph ordered as she flexed all her digits at once and a flurry of pillars chased Aang around the area like earthen serpents.

Aang was smacked around by the pillars that she erected out of the ground to hit him, they were coming in rather quickly and made it difficult to tell which direction they were coming from in the first place.

“Remember Aang, to be a Earthbender you have to be aware of the movements in the earth!” She instructed him as she continued her assault on the Avatar.
1331221111111111.title: Continue

13312211111111111.content:
Over a period of time, Aang was slowly but surely getting a hang of what she was referring to, there was a sort of tell when a pillar would appear the ground cracks near the impact as she sends it up and with a quick application of air bending he was able to evade and dodge the projectiles by mere sight and sound that made Toph whistle in respect to his abilities.

“Good work, though there's a bit more to Earthbending when you face a object, you airbenders try to dodge and evade which is nice and all, sometimes there's gonna be something you can't dodge.” Toph explained to him to which he asked jokingly, “Like you?”

She chuckled and nodded in agreement, “Yeah like me, or something a bit more stoppable for you, a giant rock, you have to know how to take danger head on, it's how a Earthbender operate, you wait and listen for the right moment to strike.”

Aang nodded obediently and closed his eyes, standing there calmly. Toph nodded and waited a few moments before smirking down at Sokka and putting a silent finger to her lips. Sokka nodded and stayed quiet as Toph flexed her big toe in the air.

A gigantic stone lifted up from the earth and whirled towards Aang’s back.

“Guys! Dinner’s read-AANG LOOK OUT!” Katara shrieked as she came upon the scene. Aang was startled out of his concentration, luckily Toph leaped to her feet and smashed the rock into bits with one swift kick..saving Aang at the last second. She landed on her odorous and dirtied bare feet with a mighty THUMP...right in front of Katara...whom she sternly glared down at.

“Dammit Katara you ruined the lesson I was trying to teach Aang!” Toph chided her annoyed at her interruption, for the moment she could feel that his heart rate was calm and ready to defend against the rock until she yelled and broke his concentration and fear from the fast approaching object.

“You mean trying to turn him into a smear on the ground?” She asked her skeptically to Toph whom scoffed at the idea of letting Aang be hurt, who did she think she was a novice?

“Look Katara, while your fancy little Waterbending and his Airbending can allow for some lapse in control and it doesn't do too much damage, this does, a little bit of trust in the giant Earthbender would be appreciated, got it?” She asked her with a stomp for emphasis, making the ground tremble.

Katara narrowed her eyes in reluctance before she sighed and nodded in defeat, “Fine, I’m sorry Toph, I guess I’m not use to how people train with Earthbending.” She told her as she nodded in agreement.

“Normally I’d suggest taking it slow, but if I’m guessing from how urgently you wanted to get me of all people to train him, then you’re on a time table right?” She asked Katara curiously.

Katara sighed and nodded, “Aang said it had to be you who teaches him..because he had some sort of vision of you in a swamp.”

Before Toph could respond, the ground began to vibrate. “O-okay what’s that?!” Sokka yelped fearfully.

“Something big is headed this way….” Toph declared and turned towards where she could tell the quakes were originating from.

“It’s some kind of...tank.” Toph said as she could sense it along with a trio of females within.

“Something big? Looks like this is a job for you!” Aang said cheerfully to Toph.

Toph grinned as she cracked her knuckles in anticipation and looked in the direction of the tank that was coming to them.

“I’m already on it.” She said as she started to walk towards the disturbance she was feeling, brushing through the trees that was about waist high to her that was near the valley.

The ground shook from her footsteps as Katara looked on in slight concern for her safety, while she was pretty big, she was unsure if whatever that was coming would be difficult for her to handle at this point.

“Well let's see if she can do her job of ‘Strongest Earthbender’ eh guys?” Sokka asked rhetorically as the others nodded.

The trees cracked in two against her legs and lower body, she had a smug grin on her face as she felt the fallen tree trunks being smashed beneath her powerful soles.

She could sense the features of the large armored vehicle barrelling towards her and the presence of three powerful girls within. The tank came to a halt before the edge of the forest, just as Toph stomped out in front of it.

A haughty voice declared from a speaker on the tank, “You are interfering with a Fire Nation matter….move it.”

“I don't think so little girl, I know exactly why you’re here, you’re after Aang aren't you?” She asked rhetorically with her hands on her hips, she knows well why they are here.

“If you continue to interfere with our pursuit peasant, then you will face a costly consequence.” The voice retorted in an arrogant tone as Toph’s eyebrow twitched in annoyance, ‘Peasant'?

“Well then I hope you don't mind if I do this then.” She said stepping towards the vehicle as the ground shake from her footsteps. Toph then started to bend over to lift up the train, though it was a bit heavier than what she was used to from the front.
13312211111111111.title: Continue

choices: The Trio puts up a Fight of course!
Toph is too powerful and intimidating...looks like she has new toys!
133122111111111111.content:
Toph grunted and grit her teeth as she struggled to hoist the train up, she managed to eventually toss it up in the air. It landed on it's back as the occupants within yelped pathetically as they were jostled.

Toph grinned smugly and lifted one dirtied and very odorous foot, slamming it on the upturned war machine and causing a foot shaped dent.

"Now...what's that you were saying...about me being a peasant and interfering with stupid ol' Fire Nation stuff?" She grinned wickedly, she'd needed something to play with...all she'd had for a while was Sokka and she wouldn't be too rough with him.

The armored side of the tank where Toph had her foot was slowly being pushed in, Ty-Lee was yelling comically as Azula and Mai crinkled their noses as the powerful aroma of Toph's foot seemed to leak in despite the metal plating.

Toph lifted her foot and stomped it down again and again, slamming the undercarriage of the war machine and damaging it beyond repair.

Finally deciding to get a look at these Fire Benders...she reached down and tore off the entire bottom half to reveal Ty Lee, Azula and Mai glaring up at her as she smirked.
133122111111111111.title: Continue

choices: They decide its time to escape and replan.
Toph manages to persevere the odds and captures them.
1331221111111111111.content:
"And here I thought killer heels were the only thinh to worry about." Mai dryly snarked out loud as they jumped out of the ruined vehicle just when Toph stomped on where they were standing, causing the metal to warp around her foot.

"That's quite the mouth you got there emo." Toph remarked as she hoisted her foot out of the wreckage and flexed her toes, settling them back onto the ground with a tremor.

"And you will learn respect peasant!" Azula shouted out as she threw out Blue Flames at Toph who raised her arms to block the attack, feeling how much stronger it was than an average attack.

"Well what do you know? I guess you aren't like the average firebender since I can feel the heat is hotter than normal." Toph pointed out as she stomped her foot to disorient them and to throw up a jagged dulled spikes to send after them, after all, capturing them would get her quite a bit of browny points with the gang.

"Hmph, I'm no ordinary Firebender, and despite your size you will fall to my flames." Azula taunted her as she fired out more as Ty Lee used her barrage as a distraction as she then went to the rather smelly foot.

'Geez does this girl ever hear of a shower?' She wondered as she threw a few series of punches designed to block her chi through her body and render Toph with one leg temporarily.

"Gonna have to do better tha-!" She taunted Azula as she was about to throw a wave of rocks at her before she felt her right foot feel like it was falling asleep.

"What the hell?" She demanded as her foot felt numb like someone threw ice at the thing as she used the foot to kick Ty Lee into a nearby tree.

Things is actually a bit more challenging for the growing Toph after all.
1331221111111111111.title: The Trio puts up a Fight of course!

13312211111111111111.content:
With Ty Lee preoccupying the girl, Azula moved in. Sending a wave of blue flames from her hand and up to the sky. More specifically towards her eyes. Planning on blinding her and attacking her eyes she got a direct hit.

“Ahh, you little-” Toph said taking a step back, holding the burns as she's officially angry.

“Your blind, stand down before we decide to take this further” Azula threatened, loving to see someone so big on the losing end. Azula always prided with her strength and battle strategy, taking down an opponent this size will be quite the accomplishment.

Toph opened her eyes and blew upwards, getting the smoking feeling out of her fringe. That defiantly got her more focused. Normally she doesn't really fight fire benders, so maybe she got a bit reckless. Smirking “Your right I'm blind, but unlike you three i don't need my eyes to see” Toph said as she stepped hard onto the ground. “And now... i know which one to go for”

Ty Lee and Mai heard this threat and realised something. Azalea’s in trouble.

“Uh Azula, maybe you should run?” Ty Lee added as Azula glared at her.

“I am the daughter of fire lord Ozai. I don't run, now get ready. We will take this girl down in the honour of the fire nation” Azula said as she sent a flame, both girls running to the side to ambush Toph. Something that Toph didn't really care about.

She runs forward and jumps, planning to stomp Azula into nothing. Azula being quick on her feet as well dodged backwards, perpelling herself with her flames. Toph kept chasing though and although Azula tries she cant escape forever.

“Mai, do something” Ty Lee said as she watched Toph chase her friend. She cant go near her while she's stomping, far to dangerous!

“Im trying, she cant even feel my needles” Mai said as she was also barely doing anything. Both could only watch as Azula struggled to dodge.
 Eventually she couldn't even do that. Toph reached down and Azula couldn't dodge anymore. getting grabbed by Toph’s big fat hand. Azula gets wrapped in her hand as she gets raised up. Not enough room to bend, and being far to weak to escape Azula was helpless right now.

A fact she cant seem to understand.

“Unhand me you peasant” She yelled as Toph just laughed at her, her giant mouth right in front of her.

“Peasant? Im the Earth Bending Queen! Better show some respect to me or else”

Azula didn't respond as she just wiggled some more, seeing that she's not getting out. “Ty Lee! Mai! Do something!” Azula commanded.

Ty Lee wanting to help her struggling friend moved forward only to get stop by Mai.

“We have to help her!” Ty Lee said.

“We have to escape! Were no match for her... if we run in were just gonna get squashed like bugs”

“But... Azula?”

“We will come back for her, we cant do anything all three of us get captured” Mai explained.

What happens next?
13312211111111111111.title: Toph Dominates

choices: Bring her back to the camp?
133122111111111111111.content:
Ty Lee looks apprehensive at the fact that her friend was caught in Toph's grip as she struggled to break herself free of it but was unable to do so, but on the other hand she was right, if they stayed Toph would eventually catch them too..

Having made her decision, she looked to Mai and nodded in agreement, a focused look on her face, "Alright, but we better come back for her." She said to her which she nodded in understanding.

"Of course." She said as the ground shook beneath them as she looked to see Toph lifting her foot up over them as they jumped out of the way when she slammed it down where they were, kicking up a lot of dust.

"You guys seem to really like monologuing, hope you don't mind if I cut in on it." She taunted them as stepped forward towards them.

"We'll be back for you Azula!" Ty Lee promised her as they leapt up to their feet and bolted towards the forested section of the area, they managed to get there as Toph scoffed in annoyance at them deciding to now leave.

"Well I guess they're smart enough to know when to retreat." Toph mused and brought the glaring princess to her face smugly looking at her.

"But the matter is what to do with you?" She wondered.
133122111111111111111.title: they run away

choices: Toph Keeps Them in There as she Heads Back to Camp!
Toph Picks them Up and Carries them Back!
Toph plays with them a little bit
13312211111111111112.content:
Speaking of growing, a familiar tingle began to spread throughout the 65ft girl's body. Recognizing that familiar feeling, she grinned widely. "Oooh, you puny fire ants are gonna get it now!" She laughed as before Mai and Azula's horrified eyes (Ty Lee was now unconscious from the kick), Toph began to shoot up in height.

This growth spurt seemed to last a lot longer than any previous, her already quite large barefeet spread out across the ground and practically chased Azula and Mai across the grassy landscape.

Toph grinned and stretched her arms towards the sun, her senses were becoming even more acute and she was able to make out more and more through that strange version of 'sight' the potion had seemed to gift her.

Aang, Katara and Sokka looked in awe as they saw Aang's teacher getting bigger and bigger in the distance.

Her growth didn't stop until she hit 105 ft tall, a vast increase from her previous.

"Ha ha ha ha ha! You fire ants are SO screwed!" Her voice had deepened and had an echoing quality to it.

She sensed and felt a furious squirming between her big and second toe on her left foot. A sly grin formed on her face as she squatted down to gaze at her prize: Azula, Ty-Lee and Mai were firmly stuck to her sweaty toe crevices.

"Aww, looks like you weren't fast enough to escape my feet." Toph mocked in a booming voice.
13312211111111111112.title: Toph Victorious

choices: Toph makes it back with no further incidents.
Azula manages to free her arm to fire lightning at her.
133122111111111111122.content:
She sneered at their pathetic struggling as she could feel them writhing and clawing to get away from her feet as she chuckled in amusement, "Well, looks like you guys are in quite the bind." She taunted them.

"Get off of us you peasant or face the consequences of the crowned Princess!" Azula tried to threaten her only to have her chest squeezed by Toph's toes for her troubles.

"Is that so? Looks like your royal powers aren't doing jack against me, how about you show some real power?" She taunted her as she eases up on them to pick them up, it won't do for a good enough bargaining chip with the Fire Nation like one of the royal family members.

Mai and Azula struggled in her iron clad grip as she smirked at them, "You three just sit tight, I'll make sure you three prisoners are treated decently." She taunted them as she made her way back to the camp, the images were coming at a more detailed rate from her growth spurt.

It was almost like she could see everything in color and like actual eyes, but she still can't really see the sky, maybe she'll be able to see vibrations of light or something.
133122111111111111122.title: Toph Picks them Up and Carries them Back!

1331221111111111111221.content:
The ground around the trio of Aang, Sokka and Katara rumbled as the humongous Earth Bending master stomped towards them.

Trees snapped like twigs under her immense and still very odorous feet, speaking of which...her foot odor could be smelled for miles.

"Ugh..." Katara pinched her nose and fanned the air. Sokka pinched his own...but had to admit the smell had grown on him from how much time Toph had spent with him.

Toph's shadow overtook them and she greeted them in her now booming voice: "What's up? I got our three stalkers right here." She pointed to the three Fire Nation scum in her fist.

"Alriiiight! Way to go teacher!" Aang cheered, causing Toph to grin smugly.

"So what are we going to do with them?" Katara inquired curiously.

"Yeah and how can we transport them without...y'know...getting ourselves killed in our sleep or something." Sokka asked with a raised eyebrow.

"Oh don't worry...we wouldn't wait until you're asleep to kill you." Azula sneered...earning a quick squeeze from Toph's fist.

"I'd shut up if I were you, Fire Ant Princess." Toph sneered.

"But yeah I was figuring we'd use em' as a bargaining chip...Fire Nation'll want their princess back no doubt. And don't worry....they'll stay with me mostly...I had a couple ideas." Toph smirked wickedly.

Soon after this...Toph had Mei under the bends of her toes on one foot, and Ty Lee bound to her sole on that foot. Azula being the princess...had a foot all to herself...the colossal sole of her other foot...each of them was facing her feet and were secured via rope.

"Ahhh...thanks for being my foot comforters." Toph was sitting with her huge soles on display and relaxing.
1331221111111111111221.title: Toph makes it back with no further incidents.

They encounter trouble along the way!
13312211111111111112211.content:
The three girls struggled and attempted to break free of their bindings as they found that the ropes tied to the foot and such was hard to break, also what with Toph shaking them down of any sharp objects to cut away the ropes.

"Though on the other hand, this might not last long what with the growing and all, but this is still pretty awesome." Toph said happily enjoying their struggles wiggling her toes pleasantly, wafting her foot odor into their noses as they retched from the smell.

Aang adopted a thinking pose on a nearby boulder to sit on, "Hmm, but I don't think we can keep them here as prisoners forever, I doubt the Fire Nation will let you keep them." He considered.

Toph groaned in annoyance, while she is confident about taking on all challengers, theres nothing stopping then from just pulling out all the stops to get them back and she isn't that confident in fighting an entire nation, maybe if she was bigger but right now its not very viable.

"Well I guess you're right, I'd say if you guys want to dump them somewhere, we could drop them in Ba Sing Se." Toph considered as the group understood the benefits of doing so, they did had an idea of going to the Earth Kingdom capital to get help to take the fight to the Fire Nation.

"Alright then, we can get there in a matter of weeks, hopefully we can get there by then." Sokka said putting down some estimates in how to get there, depending on how they travel there.
13312211111111111112211.title: Continue 1

choices: Sokka Does as he's Told as Aang Returns to Re-bind the Fire-Ants
133122111111111111122111.content:
"Won't we have to cross a desert?" Katara asked with slight dread. However, a wide grin formed on Toph's face as she stood up to her feet, placing her hands on her hips as she enjoyed the Fire-Ants' writhing beneath her.

"A desert? Oooho...you little fire-ants are SOOOO screwed!" Toph roared with laughter as her friends sweatdropped.

A familiar tingling hit Toph's body as she knew what was coming, and that grin morphed into a devilish grin. "Better back up little guys, your queen is about to get even BIGGER!" Toph declared smugly.

Aang, Sokka and Katara backed up as the gargantuan and oh-so smelly feet spread out across the ground..no doubt smothering Toph's prisoners even more.

Toph enjoyed the sensation as she grew and grew...until she was a whopping 127ft tall! "Whoa! That's one big spurt!" Sokka blurted.

Toph smirked and sat her rear down, taking out many trees with her rump. "Yo, Earth-Bending newbie! Go grab some new bindings for my Fire-Ant sandals!" Toph's voice boomed down to Aang.

Aang comically stood up and saluted, rushing to their supplies to obtain new bindings.

"Now hold on! Don't just waste all our materials just so you can torment those assassins!" Katara scolded.

Toph rolled her eyes and yawned in a disinterested way, "Nah...I'll give it back when I'm done."

Katara's eye twitched in annoyance, "We won't be able to use it when its all wet and stinks of your feet!" She shrieked.

"Sorry, not my problem." Toph shrugged before turning to Sokka and smiling: "Yo, Sokka...tell me how puny these bugs look on my soles! Praise your queen!" She said in a bossy tone.

Aang came out soon after along with Katara holding stronger and sturdier bindings to affix to the girls to her soles, though her sweat was doing a good job of adherring them to the surface, and due to the fatigue from being used as a insole, they didnt respond much to the new changing of bindings to fight back.

Aang explained to her as the others except Toph got on to Appa, "We'll see if we can find anyone overhead, just follow our lead." He told Toph as they took off in the direction of the desert.

While Toph walked onwards towards the sandy dunes, keeping in pace with the gang due to her sheer size with ease.
